text: I thought I would show you what I use to

new microphone for a while I was using
an audio technica and so I'm just going
to show you the difference so right now
you're listening to me through the
microphones on the camera and I'm
standing about you know six feet from
the camera and this is a pretty
echoey place so you're probably hearing
a lot of echoes and that tends to be
kind of annoying you know it lowers the
sound quality so one way you can reduce
the amount of echo in the audio track is
to put a microphone very close to the
sound source my mouth so I bought a
audio-technica ATR 3350 which is a
pretty low cost microphone so let's
listen to that now okay so now you're
now listening to the audio technica and
this is like a twenty or thirty dollar
microphone probably new on eBay twenty
or thirty dollars I think and I think
it's probably one of the least expensive
lavalier microphones you can find and
I'm recording it into a zoom handy h4

hands at the beginning of the track to
synchronize the camera to the audio
track and then put them together in the

microphone is not so great I used it for
a while and you can hear that the the
high frequency response is not very good
I sound very dull and sort of worn down
so to more than usual and so to
compensate for that I can play with the
equalizer settings so now you're
listening to me with the equalizer
turned up on the high end to try to
bring back some of those high

sony microphones have an output level of

rate microphones in kind of strange

even without spending a lot on the
